Great to be featured on Barron‚Äôs today discussing $TSLA earnings.

The key issue this quarter is what ‚Äúunsupervised driving‚Äù means in practice. Austin is the credibility test case for where it works, when it works & under what conditions.

I do believe FSD monetization is the bridge to the robotaxi future & this is where that bridge gets stress tested.

My predictions for upcoming hyperscaler earnings:

‚Ä¢ $MSFT: ‚ÄúWe are power constrained‚Äù
‚Ä¢ $META: ‚ÄúWe are power constrained‚Äù
‚Ä¢ $GOOGL: ‚ÄúWe are power constrained‚Äù
‚Ä¢ $AMZN: ‚ÄúWe are power constrained‚Äù
$UNH tanking on Medicare rate + guidance concerns

HOW $AMZN IS BUILT FOR THE NEW DIGITAL ECONOMY

‚Ä¢ Vertically integrates the AI stack from consumer demand (Alexa+, Rufus) to cloud infra(AWS)
‚Ä¢ Embeds AI directly into physical operations through Robotics, Zoox & Prime Air
‚Ä¢ Monetizes AI usage via ads, performance DSP & retail recommendations
‚Ä¢ Controls AI economics with custom silicon (Trainium, Inferentia) & Nitro
‚Ä¢ Supplies foundation models & choice via Amazon Nova & Anthropic
‚Ä¢ Abstracts AI into a platform with Bedrock, AgentCore & Q for enterprise adoption
‚Ä¢ Owns the data layer with OpenSearch & vector databases that power retrieval & agents

AI is becoming memory-first as models and agents ‚Äúthink‚Äù longer and retain more context

Memory is now the bottleneck across data centers, edge, autonomy and agentic systems which is why $MU sits at the center of this cycle.

2026 looks like the year agentic AI takes off with value shifting from software seats to infrastructure consumption.

$NET Workers & $DOCN compute are positioned for agent workloads as the toll roads for low-latency execution, API access & cheap, scalable infrastructure.

$RR up ~18% after announcing a collaboration with $MSFT to upgrade its ADAM robot with Azure-powered agentic AI, adding vision, voice & reasoning

It shows how cloud AI can upgrade physical robots at scale without new hardware.
$META has committed to pay $GLW up to $6B through 2030 for fiber-optic cable to support its AI data center buildout

$RDW up over 10% after being named a vendor on the Missile Defense Agency‚Äôs $151B SHIELD IDIQ.

The win expands Redwire‚Äôs homeland defense footprint, though IDIQ awards don‚Äôt guarantee revenue.
$NVDA just shared a video showing how physical AI comes to the real world this year by reshaping manufacturing with digital twins and real-time simulation.
$UNH down over 12% pre-market on flat Medicare rate proposal and an earnings miss.

$UNH Q4 EARNINGS

‚Ä¢ Revenue $113.2B vs Est. $113.9B
‚Ä¢ EPS $2.11 vs Est. $2.10
‚Ä¢ Medical Care Ratio: 92.4% vs Est. 92.1%

FY26 Guidance
‚Ä¢ Revenue $439B vs Est. $456B
‚Ä¢ EPS $17.75 vs Est. $17.69

$NET is becoming the gatekeeper of the modern internet.

The picks-and-shovels winner of agentic AI is up another 10% pre-market.
Here are the key levels to watch for $UNH on a potential bounce that's using Price Action Concepts Indicator from LuxAlgo:

Everyone knows Azure demand is growing faster than $MSFT can deploy capacity which means near-term revenue understates the backlog.

The real tell is whether Azure is gaining or losing share while $AMZN AWS & $GOOGL Cloud are also supply-constrained so whoever deploys capacity fastest will win market share.

Great to be featured on MarketWatch today discussing $TSLA earnings.

The core auto business looks increasingly mature & under pricing pressure while valuation is really underwriting autonomy &robotics. If Tesla delivers specific, credible updates there then the stock can rally even with messy car numbers.

$RKLB reusable 14-meter ‚ÄúHungry Hippo‚Äù fairing has arrived at Neutron‚Äôs Launch Complex 3 in Virginia for checkouts and pre-launch testing.

It‚Äôs the first commercial captive fairing designed to deploy the payload and return with the vehicle.

I began buying $SLV puts into the rally as a way to anticipate a pullback toward short-term moving averages.

I also briefly traded leveraged gold/silver products like $DUST and sold most after strong after-hours moves.

Today, I remain cautiously positioned, lightly bearish $SLV via puts, neutral on $GLD, and watching whether metals sell strength or push higher to determine the next move.
